result.arabic_text: وَٱلذَّٰرِيَٰتِ ذَرۡوٗا
result.translation: (1) By the [winds] scattering [dust], dispersing [it]

result.arabic_text: فَٱلۡحَٰمِلَٰتِ وِقۡرٗا
result.translation: (2) And the [clouds] carrying a load [of water]

result.arabic_text: فَٱلۡجَٰرِيَٰتِ يُسۡرٗا
result.translation: (3) And the ships sailing with ease

result.arabic_text: فَٱلۡمُقَسِّمَٰتِ أَمۡرًا
result.translation: (4) And the [angels] apportioning [each] matter,

result.arabic_text: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَصَادِقٞ
result.translation: (5) Indeed, what you are promised is true.

result.arabic_text: وَإِنَّ ٱلدِّينَ لَوَٰقِعٞ
result.translation: (6) And indeed, the recompense is to occur.

result.arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡحُبُكِ
result.translation: (7) By the heaven containing pathways,[1535]
result.footnotes: [1535]- Explained as tracks, layers or orbits.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّكُمۡ لَفِي قَوۡلٖ مُّخۡتَلِفٖ
result.translation: (8) Indeed, you are in differing speech.[1536]
result.footnotes: [1536]- About Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) and the Qur’ān.

result.arabic_text: يُؤۡفَكُ عَنۡهُ مَنۡ أُفِكَ
result.translation: (9) Deluded away from it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is he who is deluded.

result.arabic_text: قُتِلَ ٱلۡخَرَّٰصُونَ
result.translation: (10) Destroyed are the misinformers[1537]

result.arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ فِي غَمۡرَةٖ سَاهُونَ
result.translation: (11) Who are within a flood [of confusion] and heedless.

result.arabic_text: يَسۡـَٔلُونَ أَيَّانَ يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ
result.translation: (12) They ask, "When is the Day of Recompense?"

result.arabic_text: يَوۡمَ هُمۡ عَلَى ٱلنَّارِ يُفۡتَنُونَ
result.translation: (13) [It is] the Day they will be tormented over the Fire

result.arabic_text: ذُوقُواْ فِتۡنَتَكُمۡ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ
result.translation: (14) [And will be told], "Taste your torment. This is that for which you were impatient."

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَعُيُونٍ
result.translation: (15) Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and springs,

result.arabic_text: ءَاخِذِينَ مَآ ءَاتَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُحۡسِنِينَ
result.translation: (16) Accepting what their Lord has given them. Indeed, they were before that doers of good.

result.arabic_text: كَانُواْ قَلِيلٗا مِّنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ مَا يَهۡجَعُونَ
result.translation: (17) They used to sleep but little of the night,[1538]
result.footnotes: [1538]- i.e., spending a portion of the night in prayer and supplication.

result.arabic_text: وَبِٱلۡأَسۡحَارِ هُمۡ يَسۡتَغۡفِرُونَ
result.translation: (18) And in the hours before dawn they would ask forgiveness,

result.arabic_text: وَفِيٓ أَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ حَقّٞ لِّلسَّآئِلِ وَٱلۡمَحۡرُومِ
result.translation: (19) And from their properties was [given] the right of the [needy] petitioner and the deprived.

result.arabic_text: وَفِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ ءَايَٰتٞ لِّلۡمُوقِنِينَ
result.translation: (20) And on the earth are signs for the certain [in faith]

result.arabic_text: وَفِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡۚ أَفَلَا تُبۡصِرُونَ
result.translation: (21) And in yourselves. Then will you not see?

result.arabic_text: وَفِي ٱلسَّمَآءِ رِزۡقُكُمۡ وَمَا تُوعَدُونَ
result.translation: (22) And in the heaven is your provision and whatever you are promised.

result.arabic_text: فَوَرَبِّ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ إِنَّهُۥ لَحَقّٞ مِّثۡلَ مَآ أَنَّكُمۡ تَنطِقُونَ
result.translation: (23) Then by the Lord of the heaven and earth, indeed, it is truth - just as [sure as] it is that you are speaking.

result.arabic_text: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ضَيۡفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلۡمُكۡرَمِينَ
result.translation: (24) Has there reached you the story of the honored guests of Abraham?[1539] -
result.footnotes: [1539]- Who were angels given honored positions by Allāh.

result.arabic_text: إِذۡ دَخَلُواْ عَلَيۡهِ فَقَالُواْ سَلَٰمٗاۖ قَالَ سَلَٰمٞ قَوۡمٞ مُّنكَرُونَ
result.translation: (25) When they entered upon him and said, "[We greet you with] peace." He answered, "[And upon you] peace; [you are] a people unknown."

result.arabic_text: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ فَجَآءَ بِعِجۡلٖ سَمِينٖ
result.translation: (26) Then he went to his family and came with a fat [roasted] calf.

result.arabic_text: فَقَرَّبَهُۥٓ إِلَيۡهِمۡ قَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
result.translation: (27) And placed it near them; he said, "Will you not eat?"

result.arabic_text: فَأَوۡجَسَ مِنۡهُمۡ خِيفَةٗۖ قَالُواْ لَا تَخَفۡۖ وَبَشَّرُوهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ عَلِيمٖ
result.translation: (28) And he felt from them apprehension.[1540] They said, "Fear not," and gave him good tidings of a learned boy.

result.arabic_text: فَأَقۡبَلَتِ ٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ فِي صَرَّةٖ فَصَكَّتۡ وَجۡهَهَا وَقَالَتۡ عَجُوزٌ عَقِيمٞ
result.translation: (29) And his wife approached with a cry [of alarm] and struck her face and said, "[I am] a barren old woman!"

result.arabic_text: قَالُواْ كَذَٰلِكِ قَالَ رَبُّكِۖ إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ
result.translation: (30) They said, "Thus has said your Lord; indeed, He is the Wise, the Knowing."

result.arabic_text: ۞ قَالَ فَمَا خَطۡبُكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ
result.translation: (31) [Abraham] said, "Then what is your business [here], O messengers?"

result.arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّآ أُرۡسِلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ قَوۡمٖ مُّجۡرِمِينَ
result.translation: (32) They said, "Indeed, we have been sent to a people of criminals[1541]
result.footnotes: [1541]- i.e., those who defied Lot (upon him be peace).

result.arabic_text: لِنُرۡسِلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حِجَارَةٗ مِّن طِينٖ
result.translation: (33) To send down upon them stones of clay,

result.arabic_text: مُّسَوَّمَةً عِندَ رَبِّكَ لِلۡمُسۡرِفِينَ
result.translation: (34) Marked in the presence of your Lord for the transgressors."

result.arabic_text: فَأَخۡرَجۡنَا مَن كَانَ فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: (35) So We brought out whoever was in them [i.e., the cities] of the believers.

result.arabic_text: فَمَا وَجَدۡنَا فِيهَا غَيۡرَ بَيۡتٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡمُسۡلِمِينَ
result.translation: (36) And We found not within them other than a [single] house of Muslims.[1542]
result.footnotes: [1542]- i.e., Lot and his family, excepting his wife.

result.arabic_text: وَتَرَكۡنَا فِيهَآ ءَايَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
result.translation: (37) And We left therein a sign for those who fear the painful punishment.

result.arabic_text: وَفِي مُوسَىٰٓ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ مُّبِينٖ
result.translation: (38) And in Moses [was a sign], when We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority.[1543]

result.arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّىٰ بِرُكۡنِهِۦ وَقَالَ سَٰحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٞ
result.translation: (39) But he turned away with his supporters and said, "A magician or a madman."

result.arabic_text: فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ وَجُنُودَهُۥ فَنَبَذۡنَٰهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡيَمِّ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٞ
result.translation: (40) So We took him and his soldiers and cast them into the sea, and he was blameworthy.

result.arabic_text: وَفِي عَادٍ إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلرِّيحَ ٱلۡعَقِيمَ
result.translation: (41) And in ʿAad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.[1544]
result.footnotes: [1544]- Barren of any benefit, i.e., evil.

result.arabic_text: مَا تَذَرُ مِن شَيۡءٍ أَتَتۡ عَلَيۡهِ إِلَّا جَعَلَتۡهُ كَٱلرَّمِيمِ
result.translation: (42) It left nothing of what it came upon but that it made it like disintegrated ruins.

result.arabic_text: وَفِي ثَمُودَ إِذۡ قِيلَ لَهُمۡ تَمَتَّعُواْ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ
result.translation: (43) And in Thamūd, when it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a time."

result.arabic_text: فَعَتَوۡاْ عَنۡ أَمۡرِ رَبِّهِمۡ فَأَخَذَتۡهُمُ ٱلصَّٰعِقَةُ وَهُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ
result.translation: (44) But they were insolent toward the command of their Lord, so the thunderbolt seized them while they were looking on.

result.arabic_text: فَمَا ٱسۡتَطَٰعُواْ مِن قِيَامٖ وَمَا كَانُواْ مُنتَصِرِينَ
result.translation: (45) And they were unable to arise, nor could they defend themselves.

result.arabic_text: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَوۡمٗا فَٰسِقِينَ
result.translation: (46) And [We destroyed] the people of Noah before; indeed, they were a people defiantly disobedient.

result.arabic_text: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ بَنَيۡنَٰهَا بِأَيۡيْدٖ وَإِنَّا لَمُوسِعُونَ
result.translation: (47) And the heaven We constructed with strength,[1545] and indeed, We are [its] expander.

result.arabic_text: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فَرَشۡنَٰهَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡمَٰهِدُونَ
result.translation: (48) And the earth We have spread out, and excellent is the preparer.

result.arabic_text: وَمِن كُلِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَا زَوۡجَيۡنِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَذَكَّرُونَ
result.translation: (49) And of all things We created two mates [i.e., counterparts]; perhaps you will remember.

result.arabic_text: فَفِرُّوٓاْ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
result.translation: (50) So flee to Allāh.[1546] Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.
result.footnotes: [1546]- i.e., turn to Allāh and take refuge in Him from disbelief and sin, thereby escaping His punishment.

result.arabic_text: وَلَا تَجۡعَلُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَۖ إِنِّي لَكُم مِّنۡهُ نَذِيرٞ مُّبِينٞ
result.translation: (51) And do not make [as equal] with Allāh another deity. Indeed, I am to you from Him a clear warner.

result.arabic_text: كَذَٰلِكَ مَآ أَتَى ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا قَالُواْ سَاحِرٌ أَوۡ مَجۡنُونٌ
result.translation: (52) Similarly, there came not to those before them any messenger except that they said, "A magician or a madman."

result.arabic_text: أَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِهِۦۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ قَوۡمٞ طَاغُونَ
result.translation: (53) Did they suggest it to them?[1547] Rather, they [themselves] are a transgressing people.
result.footnotes: [1547]- i.e., Did the former disbelievers pass on these words to the Makkans so that they repeat the same expressions?

result.arabic_text: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ فَمَآ أَنتَ بِمَلُومٖ
result.translation: (54) So leave them, [O Muḥammad], for you are not to be blamed.

result.arabic_text: وَذَكِّرۡ فَإِنَّ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ تَنفَعُ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
result.translation: (55) And remind, for indeed, the reminder benefits the believers.

result.arabic_text: وَمَا خَلَقۡتُ ٱلۡجِنَّ وَٱلۡإِنسَ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُونِ
result.translation: (56) And I did not create the jinn and mankind except to worship Me.

result.arabic_text: مَآ أُرِيدُ مِنۡهُم مِّن رِّزۡقٖ وَمَآ أُرِيدُ أَن يُطۡعِمُونِ
result.translation: (57) I do not want from them any provision, nor do I want them to feed Me.

result.arabic_text: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلرَّزَّاقُ ذُو ٱلۡقُوَّةِ ٱلۡمَتِينُ
result.translation: (58) Indeed, it is Allāh who is the [continual] Provider,[1548] the firm possessor of strength.
result.footnotes: [1548]- Providing everything required by His creations during their decreed existence.  His provision includes guidance.

result.arabic_text: فَإِنَّ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ ذَنُوبٗا مِّثۡلَ ذَنُوبِ أَصۡحَٰبِهِمۡ فَلَا يَسۡتَعۡجِلُونِ
result.translation: (59) And indeed, for those who have wronged is a portion [of punishment] like the portion of their companions [i.e., predecessors], so let them not impatiently urge Me.

result.arabic_text: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِن يَوۡمِهِمُ ٱلَّذِي يُوعَدُونَ
result.translation: (60) And woe to those who have disbelieved from their Day which they are promised.
